What is 3D printing?

3D printing is a manufacturing technology that lets you create solid three-dimensional objects from digital models. 3D prints are created by adding layers of material on top of each other – a process otherwise known as “additive manufacturing.”

You can think of a 3D printer as a micro-factory that can help you produce a variety of products in a fast and environmentally-friendly way. Keep an eye on our blog for product samples and 3D printing ideas!

How does this work?

1. Upload File

It always starts with a 3D model. If you have your 3D file (.stl), you can upload directly. Don’t have a model yet? and need inspiration? Check out Thingiverse, they feature an awesome collection of designs for 3D printing.

You can only upload STL-files, these are the standard files used in the 3D printing industry. 

2. Settings

Select the specifics like what material and colour you would like the object to be printed in.

3. Checkout

Enter your address and payment details

That’s it! Really that simple.

Now just have to wait for your delivery man to knock on your door.

Can I join with my 3D printer?

Yep! We’re the fast growing 3D printing community in the UK, register here (info@wemake.network), and we’ll add you to the Vendor waiting list.

How to I sync my Cura Engine?

These are the steps to set up a new printer, syncing the slicing you do on your desktop to the WeMake price prediction.

  1. Delete the Cura GUI log file.

Open a ‘explorer’ or ‘finder’ window on your computer, and navigate to the folder located at:

  • Windows:%APPDATA%\cura\<Cura version>\cura.log, or
    C:\Users\<your username>\AppData\Roaming\cura\<Cura version>\cura.log

    Note: The folder AppData is hidden! Ensure to ‘view hidden folders’.
  • OSX: $HOME/Library/Application Support/cura/<Cura version>/cura.log

    Note: The folder ‘Library’ is hidden! In finder select ‘Go’ and hold the ‘option’ key, to easily view the library folder.
  • Ubuntu / Linux:$HOME/.local/share/cura/<Cura version>/cura.log

2. Load Benchy in Ultimaker CURA

Open Ultimaker Cura

Open www.wemake.network > Printers > [ printer to sync ] > Price > Benchy.stl

Load Benchy.stl in Ultimaker CURA

3. Create a “WeMake” Custom Profile

In CURA: Print Settings > Profile > Manage Profiles and select the profile you’d like to use for WeMake slicing

Duplicate the profile, and save as “WeMake”

4. Slice with new profile

Slice the Benchy.stl with the new “WeMake” profile. Remember to have the profile selected.

5. Send new cura.log

Open a ‘explorer’ or ‘finder’ window on your computer, and navigate to the folder located at:

  • Windows:%APPDATA%\cura\<Cura version>\cura.log, or
    C:\Users\<your username>\AppData\Roaming\cura\<Cura version>\cura.logNote: The folder AppData is hidden! Ensure to ‘view hidden folders’.
  • OSX: $HOME/Library/Application Support/cura/<Cura version>/cura.logNote: The folder ‘Library’ is hidden! In finder select ‘Go’ and hold the ‘option’ key, to easily view the library folder.
  • Ubuntu / Linux:$HOME/.local/share/cura/<Cura version>/cura.log

Send the cura.log file to (info@wemake.network)

That’s it! We’ll have you set up shortly.

How does WeMake earn money?

WeMake is free to use for Vendors putting their 3D printers online. Vendors do not get charged for signing up or recurring charges. WeMake charges a small fee to the customer in order to cover for the payment handling and running the servers.

How do I get in touch?

You can send us a message here, with feedback, suggestions, or any further questions you may have. We’ll try to get back to you as soon as possible!
